data.title: Team – International Handball Goalkeeper Camp
data.text:
Famous goalkeeper of the Croatian National Handball Team. Olympic winner in 1984, and winner of many medals from various world’s handball championships. Goalkeeper coach in Croatian national teams. Thierry Omeyer told once that Mr Basic was his Idol when he was young so that’s mean enough about his qualities.

MIRKO BASIC – Handball goalkeeper coach

Physical Education teacher. Founder of M – Body Motion by Marina Škrobot. M-body motion is a body and mind program, which activates physical and mental components for any exerciser which seeks a body confidence and mind relief. The goal is to achieve mobility, stabilization, strength and flexibility. The main characteristics include fluidity, diversity and a great number of exercises which have their origin in yoga, pilates and gymnastics

MARINA SKROBOT – M-body motion coach

Current Goalkeeper Coach of Füchse Berlin in German Bundesliga. Over the course of his career that spanned almost three decades, Perić played for Pelister, Crvena zvezda (1991–1993), Atlético Madrid (1993–1994), Teucro (1994–1995), Celje (1995–2004 and 2011–2013), Barcelona (2004–2006) and MKB Veszprém (2006–2011). He won two consecutive EHF Champions League titles in the 2003–04 (with Celje) and 2004–05 (with Barcelona) seasons. At international level, Perić represented Serbia and Montenegro (known as FR Yugoslavia until 2003) in eight major tournaments, winning two bronze medals (1996 European Championship and 1999 World Championship).[1] He also participated in the 2000 Summer Olympics. While still a player, Perić served as an assistant to Sead Hasanefendić with the Serbia men's national handball team from 2009 to 2010. He independently led the team between 2014 and 2016, taking part in the 2016 European Championship.

DEJAN PERIC – Handball goalkeeper coach

Borko Ristovski (born 2 November 1982) is a retired Macedonian Handball Goalkeeper with 155 App for Macedonian National Team. 24 years of Professional Carieer. He became the first Macedonian handballer to play in the ASOBAL league. He won the National Titels in Macedonia (Metalurg Skopje and Vardar Skopje), Germany (Rhein Neckar Löwen), Spain (Barcelona) and Portugal (S.L. Benfica)

BORKO RISTOVSKI – Handball goalkeeper, demonstrator

Roland Mikler (born 20 September 1984) is a Hungarian handball player for SC Pick Szeged and the Hungarian national team. All-Star Goalkeeper of the EHF Champions League: 2015 Former goalkeeper of Veszprém Handball Team and Hungarian national team. Previously played in Pick Szeged. EHF Cup Winner with Pick Szeged (2014). Champion of Hungary and Hungarian cup winner with Veszprém (2015, 2016, 2017). Men’s EHF Champions League finalist (2015 and 2016). Two times SEHA League winner (2015 and 2016)

ROLAND MIKLER – Handball goalkeeper, demonstrator

One of the best world handball goalkeepers ever with the most impressive goalkeeping career! With French national team Olympic Games gold medal winner two times (2008, 2012), Olympic Games silver medalist (2016). World Championship winner five times (2001, 2009, 2011, 2015, 2017) and two times bronze medalist (2003, 2005). MVP of the World Championship (2015). All-Star Goalkeeper of the World Championship (2011, 2015). Three times European Championship winner (2006, 2010, 2014) and once bronze medalist (2008). All-Star Goalkeeper of the European Championship (2006). IHF World Player of the Year (2008). Played for SC Selestat, Montpellier HB, THW Kiel, Paris Saint Germain.

THIERRY OMEYER – Handball goalkeeper, demonstrator

Kasper Hvidt (born 6 February 1976) is a Danish retired handball goalkeeper, who lastly played for KIF Kolding and previous Danish national team. He was selected as the best keeper for the 2008 European Men's Handball Championship. Hvidt was also voted Goalkeeper of the Year on 20 March 2009, in second place was Thierry Omeyer from France.

KASPER HVIDT – Handball goalkeeper, demonstrator

Camp participant from 2011 to 2016. Since 2017 he has taken on the role of a demonstrator and from 2022 Coach. He is goalkeeper coach in German Bundesliga by SC Magdeburg. 2023 he won IHF Super Globe with SC Magdeburg.

DINO SPIRANEC – Handball goalkeeper, demonstrator

Kari Aalvik Grimsbø (born 4 January 1985) is a former Norwegian handball player who last played for Győri ETO KC and the Norwegian national team.[1][2] Since her retirement she is the goalkeeping coach at Byåsen HE. In her impressive goalkeeper career Kari has won: WITH THE NORWEGIAN NATIONAL TEAM: Olympic Games – Winner: 2008, 2012. Bronze Medalist: 2016. World Championship – Winner: 2011, 2015. Silver Medalist: 2007, 2017. Bronze Medalist: 2009. European Championship – Winner: 2006, 2008, 2010, 2014, 2016. WITH HER TEAM Győri Audi ETO KC: EHF Champions League – Winner: 2017, 2018, 2019. Silver Medalist: 2016. Nemzeti Bajnokság I – Winner: 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019. Magyar Kupa – Winner: 2015, 2016, 2018, 2019. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS: All-Star Goalkeeper of the Summer Olympics: 2012 and 2016. All-Star Team Best Goalkeeper of the EHF Champions League: 2016, 2017, 2018. MVP of the EHF Champions League Final Four: 2019.

KARI AALVIK Grimsbø – Handball goalkeeper, demonstrator
